titles.title: Currency Exchange Rate Transparency Act
A bill to make bills implementing trade agreements subject to a point of order unless certain conditions are met, and for other purposes.
Currency Exchange Rate Transparency Act

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

term.name: International monetary system and foreign exchange

bill.summary: Currency Exchange Rate Transparency Act - Subjects any bill implementing a trade agreement between the United States and another country (or extending permanent normal trade relations) to a point of order unless the bill is accompanied by a Presidential certification, approved by Congress, stating that, in the 10 years prior to the certification, the government of the country has not engaged in the intervention or manipulation of the rate of exchange between its currency and the U.S. dollar in order to prevent effective balance of payments adjustments or gain unfair competitive advantage in international trade.
